q: why does the short-hair player press his body on the players
pred: The short-hair player presses his body on the players in the ring to gain an advantage over them. This is a common tactic used by wrestlers to gain leverage, control, and momentum during a match. By applying pressure to the opponent's body, the wrestler can force the opponent to move in a specific direction or to relinquish control of the match. This can give the wrestler an opportunity to execute a submission hold or to gain an advantage in the match.
